content:
# I have successfully harvested 5 coal, and my inventory now contains:
# - 5 coal
# - 5 stone
# - 5 iron ore
# - 2 iron plates
# - 1 copper plate
# - 1 copper cable
# - 1 iron gear wheel
# - 1 electronic circuit

# Now that I have coal, I can use it as a more reliable fuel source for the stone furnace. 
# Let's insert some coal into the furnace to ensure it has enough fuel for smelting.

insert_item(Prototype.Coal, target=stone_furnace_entity, quantity=3)  # Insert 3 coal into the furnace.

# After inserting the coal, I will also insert 1 iron ore to begin the smelting process again.
insert_item(Prototype.IronOre, target=stone_furnace_entity, quantity=1)  # Insert 1 iron ore.

# Now, I will wait for the smelting process to complete.
for _ in range(30):  # Maximum 30 seconds wait.
    current_inventory = inspect_inventory(stone_furnace_entity)
    if current_inventory.get(Prototype.IronPlate, 0) >= 1:  # Wait until I have at least 1 iron plate.
        break
    sleep(1)
else:
    raise Exception("Smelting timeout for iron ore - please check resources.")

# After waiting, I will attempt to extract the iron plate.
extracted_iron_plate = extract_item(Prototype.IronPlate, position=stone_furnace_entity.position, quantity=1)

# Finally, I will attempt to craft the assembling machine again.
craft_item(Prototype.AssemblingMachine1, quantity=1)

# Check the updated inventory after crafting the assembling machine.
print(f"Inventory after crafting assembling machine: {inspect_inventory()}")
